sen.j: 和知駅（わちえき）は、京都府船井郡京丹波町本庄馬場19番地1にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located at 19-1 Honjo Baba, Kyotanba-cho, Funai-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, Wachi Station is a stop on the San'in Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Wachi Station, located at 19-1 Honjo Baba, Kyotanba-cho, Funai-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the San'in Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Wachi Station, located at 19-1 Honjo Baba, Kyotanba-cho, Funai-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Sanin Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 通勤利用客向けに、朝夕には下記の特急列車が停車する。
sen.e: During the commuter rush hours in the morning and the early evening, the following limited express trains stop at this station.
The following limited express trains stop at this station during the commuter rush hours in the morning and early evening:
The following limited express trains stop at this station during the commuter rush hours in the morning and early evening:

sen.j: 上り 「たんば (列車)」2号・4号、「はしだて (列車)」2号、「まいづる (列車)」2号
sen.e: Inbound train : Limited Express "Tanba" #2, #4, "Hashidate" #2, "Maizuru" #2
Inbound train: Limited Express "Tanba" No. 2, No. 4, "Hashidate" No. 2, "Maizuru" No. 2
Inbound train: Limited Express 'Tanba' No. 2 and No. 4, 'Hashidate' No. 2, 'Maizuru' No. 2

sen.j: 下り 「たんば」7号・9号、「まいづる」11号
sen.e: Outbound train : Limited Express "Tanba" #7, #9, "Maizuru" #11
Outbound train: Limited Express "Tanba" No. 7, No. 9, "Maizuru" No. 11
Outbound train: Limited Express 'Tanba' No. 7 and No. 9, 'Maizuru' No. 11

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 単式・島式の複合型2面3線のプラットホームを持つ、行違い設備を備えた地上駅である。
sen.e: The station is on the ground, and has complex types (single type and island type) of platforms serving three tracks that run in opposite directions.
The station, which is on the ground, contains a mix of platform types (single type and island type) serving three tracks that run in opposite directions.
The above-ground station employs a variety of platform types (single type and island type) serving three tracks with facilities that allow trains running in opposite directions to pass each other.
sen.cmt: 「行き違い設備」の箇所など訳し直しました。NR: Describing a station as being "on the ground" sounds very odd to me. "above ground" would be more natural, I think.

sen.j: 簡易委託駅で売店も営業している。
sen.e: It is outsourced station with station kiosk.
It is an outsourced station with a station kiosk.
It is an outsourced station with a station kiosk.

sen.j: 駅舎は単式の1番ホーム側にあり、島式の2・3番ホームへは跨線橋で連絡している。
sen.e: The station-house is on the side of the single platform #1 and connected by an overpass to the island type platform #2/#3.
The station house is on the side of the single platform No. 1 and connected by an overpass to the island-type Platform 2 and 3.
The station house is on the side of the single platform of track No. 1 and connected by an overpass to the island-type platform of tracks nos. 2 and 3.
sen.cmt: platform of track No. xx としました。

sen.j: 園部～綾部間の山陰本線の駅では珍しく、ホームが方向別に分けられている。
sen.e: The each platform is used for one direction, that is rare among the stations between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station on the San'in Main Line.
The each platform is used for one direction, which is rare among the stations between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station on the San'in Main Line.
Each platform is used for one direction, which is rare among the stations between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station on the Sanin Main Line.

sen.j: 駅舎正面左側に町営バス・京タク乗務員事務所あり。
sen.e: Crews' offices of the municipal bus services and Kyoto Taxi are on the left front of the station-house.
The crews' offices of the municipal bus services and Kyoto Taxi are on the left side at the front of the station house.
The crews' offices of the municipal bus services and Kyoto Taxi are on the left side at the front of the station house.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization situation
Conditions of usage
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 表現を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約195人である。
sen.e: Number of usage is about 195 people a day on research in fiscal year 2006.
According to research conducted in fiscal year 2006, the station was used by approximately 195 people each day.
According to research conducted in fiscal year 2006, the station was used by approximately 195 people each day.

sen.j: 2005年度は202人であった。
sen.e: 202 people a day on 2005 fiscal year.
In fiscal year 2005, the daily usage figure was 202.
In fiscal year 2005, the daily usage figure was 202.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Statistical data of Kyoto Prefecture)
(Statistical data of Kyoto Prefecture)
(according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)

Bus

sen.j: 駅前広場より、京丹波町営バス発着・行先４系統
sen.e: Kyotamba municipal bus stop is at the station plaza, there are 4 routes.
The Kyotamba municipal bus stop is at the station plaza, and there are four routes.
The Kyotanba municipal bus stop is at the station plaza, and there are four routes.

sen.j: 朝・昼・夕に南丹市営バス直通便乗り入れ(美山静原行)
sen.e: Nantan city bus runs to the station directly morning, noon and evening. (bound for Miyama Shizuhara)
The Nantan city bus runs to the station directly during the morning, noon and evening (bound for Miyama Shizuhara).
The Nantan city bus runs to the station directly during the morning, noon and evening (bound for Miyama Shizuhara).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）8月25日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on August 25, 1910 as a station of Japan National Railways (JNR).
The station opened on August 25, 1910 as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).
August 25, 1910: The station opened as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).

sen.j: 客貨取扱を開始。
sen.e: Transport service for passengers and freights was started.
Transportation services for passengers and freight was initiated.
Transportation services for passengers and freight was initiated.

sen.j: 1973年（昭和48年）3月26日 - 貨物取扱を廃止。
sen.e: Freight service was ceased on March 26, 1973.
Freight service ceased on March 26, 1973.
March 26, 1973: Freight service ceased.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: The station became one of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of JNR on April 1, 1987.
The station became part of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of JNR on April 1, 1987.
April 1, 1987: The station became part of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of JNR.
